author: terence0083
content:
<@!360491619402776577> May I pick your brain for this one? I'm running local interop between Prysm and Geth and observed this odd behavior:

Geth logs:
```
INFO [02-15|09:16:20.076] Chain head was updated                   number=5 hash=aec60d..ab02bf root=ca3149..2bdf45 elapsed="408.525µs" age=17m28s
INFO [02-15|09:16:20.076] Creating new payload for sealing
INFO [02-15|09:16:20.076] Producing block                          parentHash=aec60d..ab02bf
INFO [02-15|09:16:20.076] Created payload for sealing              id=0x1511e4dc081eee62 elapsed="148.36µs"
WARN [02-15|09:16:20.329] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=d49a41..d6adf5
WARN [02-15|09:16:32.056] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=d49a41..d6adf5
```

- Prysm called fcu with attri and received payload where `parentHash=aec60d..ab02bf`, 
- Prysm received payload `hash=0xd49a41`, `parentHash=aec60d` and `number=6`
- Prysm called `newPayload` with `hash=0xd49a41` and received `VALID`
- Then prysm called fcu with `headBlockHash=0xd49a41` with attri and got `VALID` but `payloadID` is `nil`. This corresponds to `Forkchoice requested unknown head` in geth logging
